body.section: Hierarchy InfusionPromise is a kind of PharmacyPromise

section.title: Description
section.p: An inpatient request for intravenous medication to be administered for this patient.

stentry.p: Infusion: "Introduction of a solution into the body through a vein for therapeutic purposes." (American Heritage Stedman's Medical Dictionary). This is the rate at which the solution is introduced into the body. Expressed as volume/time (e.g., 500 ml/hr)

The site of the patient's body at which the infusion takes place. Note that there is a question, in cases where the patient is receiving multiple infusions simultaneously, whether this code should include something about the specific line, or whether there needs to be another attribtue.
Indicates whether the infusion is Continuous or Intermittant. (or Bolus?) Another possible name is infustionPersistance? (May need a better name)
Categorizes the intravenous infusion to occur. Possible values include Admixture, Piggyback, or Syringe. (May need a better name)
This is the maximum length of time or the maximum volume to administer, for IV fluid orders. The value may be in milliliters, liters, hours, or days.
